alert.note: Alert for Boyd; Carter; Greenup; Lawrence (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 5:05PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Gusty showers will impact portions of Boyd, southeastern Greenup, southeastern Carter, central Lawrence, southeastern Meigs, Lawrence, Gallia, northwestern Wirt, northern Jackson, northwestern Wayne, southwestern Wood, Mason and central Cabell Counties through 600 PM EST... At 503 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking widely scattered gusty showers along a line extending from near Rio Grande to Leisure. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Huntington, Ashland, Ironton, Point Pleasant, Grayson, Gallipolis, Louisa, Coal Grove, Pomeroy, Wayne, Chesapeake, Racine, Proctorville, Rutland, Blaine, Beech Fork State Park, Cannonsburg, Lake Vesuvius, Grayson Lake State Park and Yatesville Lake State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 142 and 165. Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 171 and 191. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EST for northeastern Kentucky...southeastern Ohio...and western and northwestern West Virginia.
